snippet: Few of the residents hold any hope of returning. Before they evacuated Friday, they kissed the ground and visited the graves of relatives for the last time....
abstract: Hundreds of Syrian rebels leave Damascus suburb of Daraya as part of deal with government that amounts to symbolic defeat for opposition groups that remained under local control and unaffiliated with extremists; many are headed for Idlib, rebel-held area under control of Islamist groups.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times from Damascus Governorate, Syria; Hwaida Saad from Beirut; and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Few of the residents hold any hope of returning. Before they evacuated Friday, they kissed the ground and visited the graves of relatives for the last time.

headline.main: Residents Abandon Daraya as Government Seizes a Symbol of Syria’s Rebellion
headline.print_headline: Residents Abandon Homes as a Symbol of Syria’s Rebellion Falls
